alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Northampton; Suffolk; Virginia Beach; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued January 02 at 10:43PM EST until January 03 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM EST MONDAY THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Two to three feet of inundation above ground level possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Isle of Wight, Norfolk/Portsmouth, Northampton, York, Newport News and Hampton/Poquoson Counties, and Suffolk, Chesapeake and Virginia Beach. * WHEN...Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. JAMES RIVER AT SCOTLAND/JAMESTOWN VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.0 FT, MODERATE 4.5 FT, MAJOR 5.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 02/11 PM 2.5 0.3 0.9 1 NONE 03/12 PM 4.5 2.3 2.1 1 MODERATE 04/12 AM 3.4 1.2 1.8 1 NONE 04/01 PM 3.7 1.5 1.4 1 NONE 05/01 AM 3.1 0.9 1.5 1 NONE SEWELLS POINT VA MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
